headline: GTCR set to reap handsome windfall from Worldpay's $24.25 billion sale
summary: Private equity firm GTCR is poised to garner a return of about two times its investment in Worldpay, after the sale of its 55% stake in the payments processor to Global Payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.  Such a big windfall has become increasingly rare in the private equity industry, which has been starved of large exits during the last two years when high interest rates froze up financing markets and slowed down the pace of large leveraged buyouts.  Earlier on Thursday, Global Payments agreed to buy Worldpay for around $24.25 billion and divest its issuer services unit for $13.5 billion in a complex three-way deal, marking one of the biggest transactions in the payments industry in recent years.

content.title: GTCR set to reap handsome windfall from Worldpay's $24.25 billion sale
content.summary: Private equity firm GTCR is poised to garner a return of about two times its investment in Worldpay, after the sale of its 55% stake in the payments processor to Global Payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.  Such a big windfall has become increasingly rare in the private equity industry, which has been starved of large exits during the last two years when high interest rates froze up financing markets and slowed down the pace of large leveraged buyouts.  Earlier on Thursday, Global Payments agreed to buy Worldpay for around $24.25 billion and divest its issuer services unit for $13.5 billion in a complex three-way deal, marking one of the biggest transactions in the payments industry in recent years.

headline: Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS) Projects Revenue Of US$2.5 Billion For Q1 2025
summary: Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS) recently released its preliminary earnings guidance for Q1 2025, expecting total revenue of $2.5 billion with a 4% growth in recurring revenue. Despite this steady outlook, the stock experienced a 5% decline over the past month. This period coincided with a greater market downturn, where the Dow Jones Industrial Average slipped, influenced by several tech and healthcare sector pressures. headline: D.H. Horton outlook, Fidelity National Information Services deal
summary: Josh Lipton recaps the top stories on Wall Street in just 60 seconds as part of today's Market Minute. D.H. Horton (DHI) stock is in focus after the company's second quarter results missed estimates on the top and bottom lines. The homebuilder also cut its full-year outlook. Fidelity National Information Services (FIS) announces plans to acquire Issuer Solutions from Global Payments (GPN) for $13.5 billion and sell its stake in World Pay to Global Payments in a $22.7 billion deal. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: D.H. Horton outlook, Fidelity National Information Services deal
content.description:
Josh Lipton recaps the top stories on Wall Street in just 60 seconds as part of today's Market Minute.

D.H. Horton (DHI) stock is in focus after the company's second quarter results missed estimates on the top and bottom lines. The homebuilder also cut its full-year outlook.

Fidelity National Information Services (FIS) announces plans to acquire Issuer Solutions from Global Payments (GPN) for $13.5 billion and sell its stake in World Pay to Global Payments in a $22.7 billion deal.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Global Payments buying Worldpay in $22 billion deal
summary: Payment processing company Global Payments is buying Cincinnati-based rival Worldpay for more than $22 billion to expand its global footprint. The move bolsters the financial technology company, enabling about 94 billion transactions and $3.7 trillion in payment volumes across more than 175 countries. Payment processing companies, which include household names Visa and Mastercard, facilitate financial transactions between customers, businesses and banks.

content.title: Global Payments buying Worldpay in $22 billion deal
content.summary: Payment processing company Global Payments is buying Cincinnati-based rival Worldpay for more than $22 billion to expand its global footprint. The move bolsters the financial technology company, enabling about 94 billion transactions and $3.7 trillion in payment volumes across more than 175 countries. Payment processing companies, which include household names Visa and Mastercard, facilitate financial transactions between customers, businesses and banks.

headline: Global Payments Stock Swoons Following $24B Worldpay Acquisition
summary: Shares of Global Payments tumbled 17% Thursday after the fintech firm announced the acquisition of payment processing company Worldpay from private equity firm GTCR and Fidelity National Information Services for $24.25 billion in cash and stock.

content.title: Global Payments Stock Swoons Following $24B Worldpay Acquisition
content.summary: Shares of Global Payments tumbled 17% Thursday after the fintech firm announced the acquisition of payment processing company Worldpay from private equity firm GTCR and Fidelity National Information Services for $24.25 billion in cash and stock.

headline: FIS strikes deal worth billions to sell Worldpay to Global Payments in a ‘home run’ for the most powerful woman in fintech
summary: FIS, run by CEO Stephanie Ferris, is one of the world’s biggest financial services companies with a $38 billion market capitalization.

content.title: FIS strikes deal worth billions to sell Worldpay to Global Payments in a ‘home run’ for the most powerful woman in fintech
content.summary: FIS, run by CEO Stephanie Ferris, is one of the world’s biggest financial services companies with a $38 billion market capitalization.

thumbnail.caption: Stephanie Ferris is CEO of Fidelity National Information Services, or FIS.

headline: Global Payments agrees $24.25 billion Worldpay deal as industry heavyweights shift focus
summary: (Reuters) -Global Payments has agreed to buy rival Worldpay from FIS and private equity firm GTCR for $24.25 billion in a three-way deal, sharpening its focus on merchant services in its race for big-business clients in a crowded payments market.  As part of the deal announced on Thursday, Global Payments will sell its issuer solutions unit, which offers card processing and account services, to FIS for $13.5 billion.  The agreements will be transformative for two of the world's largest processors of digital payments, with Global becoming a pureplay payments processor to businesses and FIS solidifying its offering around services to financial institutions.

content.title: Global Payments agrees $24.25 billion Worldpay deal as industry heavyweights shift focus
content.summary: (Reuters) -Global Payments has agreed to buy rival Worldpay from FIS and private equity firm GTCR for $24.25 billion in a three-way deal, sharpening its focus on merchant services in its race for big-business clients in a crowded payments market.  As part of the deal announced on Thursday, Global Payments will sell its issuer solutions unit, which offers card processing and account services, to FIS for $13.5 billion.  The agreements will be transformative for two of the world's largest processors of digital payments, with Global becoming a pureplay payments processor to businesses and FIS solidifying its offering around services to financial institutions.

headline: GTCR Announces Sale of Worldpay to Global Payments for $24.25 Billion in Conjunction with Transformative Three-Way Transaction
summary: GTCR, a leading private equity firm, announced today the signing of a definitive agreement to sell Worldpay (the "Company"), a global leader in merchant acquiring and payments processing, to Global Payments (NYSE: GPN) for $24.25 billion as part of a transformative three-way transaction.

content.title: GTCR Announces Sale of Worldpay to Global Payments for $24.25 Billion in Conjunction with Transformative Three-Way Transaction
content.summary: GTCR, a leading private equity firm, announced today the signing of a definitive agreement to sell Worldpay (the "Company"), a global leader in merchant acquiring and payments processing, to Global Payments (NYSE: GPN) for $24.25 billion as part of a transformative three-way transaction.

headline: FIS Announces Sale of Worldpay Stake and Strategic Acquisition of Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions Business
summary: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 17, 2025--FIS® (NYSE: FIS), (the "Company") a global leader in financial technology, today announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire 100% of Global Payments' (NYSE: GPN) Issuer Solutions business for an enterprise value of $13.5 billion, or a net purchase price of $12 billion including $1.5 billion of anticipated net present value of tax assets.

content.title: FIS Announces Sale of Worldpay Stake and Strategic Acquisition of Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions Business
content.summary: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 17, 2025--FIS® (NYSE: FIS), (the "Company") a global leader in financial technology, today announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire 100% of Global Payments' (NYSE: GPN) Issuer Solutions business for an enterprise value of $13.5 billion, or a net purchase price of $12 billion including $1.5 billion of anticipated net present value of tax assets.

headline: FIS, Global Payments agree to Worldpay deal
summary: Fidelity National Information Services and Global Payments unveiled a deal Thursday in which FIS plans to buy the latter’s issuer business and sell its Worldpay stake.

content.title: FIS, Global Payments agree to Worldpay deal
content.summary: Fidelity National Information Services and Global Payments unveiled a deal Thursday in which FIS plans to buy the latter’s issuer business and sell its Worldpay stake.

summary: Private equity firm GTCR is poised to garner a return of about two times its investment in Worldpay, after the sale of its 55% stake in the payments processor to Global Payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.  Such a big windfall has become increasingly rare in the private equity industry, which has been starved of large exits during the last two years when high interest rates froze up financing markets and slowed down the pace of large leveraged buyouts.  Earlier on Thursday, Global Payments agreed to buy Worldpay for around $24.25 billion and divest its issuer services unit for $13.5 billion in a complex three-way deal, marking one of the biggest transactions in the payments industry in recent years.
